intro: Haplodiscus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with rough textures, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Haplodiscus latifolius is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
